00050 from Koo.Common import Options
00051 
00052 
00053 for logger in Options.options['logging.logger'].split(','):
00054         if len(logger):
00055                 loglevel = {'DEBUG':logging.DEBUG, 'INFO':logging.INFO, 'WARNING':logging.WARNING, 'ERROR':logging.ERROR, 'CRITICAL':logging.CRITICAL}
00056                 log = logging.getLogger(logger)
00057                 log.setLevel(loglevel[Options.options['logging.level'].upper()])
00058 if Options.options['logging.verbose']:
00059         logging.getLogger().setLevel(logging.INFO)
00060 else:
00061         logging.getLogger().setLevel(logging.ERROR)

00066 from PyQt4.QtCore import *
00067 from PyQt4.QtGui import *
00068 try:
00069         import dbus.mainloop.qt
00070         import dbus.service
00071         import dbus
00072         imports['dbus'] = True 
00073 except:
00074         imports['dbus'] = False
00075         print _("Module 'dbus' not available. Consider installing it so other applications can easily interact with Koo.")
00076 imports['dbus'] = False

00083 Notifier.concurrencyErrorHandler = Common.concurrencyError

00087 # The OpenErpInterface gives access from DBUS to local api.
00088 # To test it you may simply use the following command line: 
00089 # qdbus org.openerp.Interface /OpenERP org.openerp.Interface.call "gui.window" "create" "None, 'res.partner', False, [], 'form', mode='form,tree'"
00090 #
00091 if imports['dbus']:
00092         class OpenErpInterface(dbus.service.Object):
00093                 def __init__(self, path):
00094                         dbus.service.Object.__init__(self, dbus.SessionBus(), path)
00095 
00096                 # This function lets execute any given function of any local service. See example above.
00097                 @dbus.service.method(dbus_interface='org.openerp.Interface', in_signature='sss', out_signature='')
00098                 def call(self, serviceName, function, parameters):
00099                         obj = service.LocalService(serviceName)
00100                         f = 'obj.%s(%s)' % (function, parameters) 
00101                         eval(f)
00102 
00103 ### Main application loop
00104 if Common.isKdeAvailable:
00105         from PyKDE4.kdecore import ki18n, KAboutData, KCmdLineArgs
00106         from PyKDE4.kdeui import KApplication
00107 
00108         appName     = "Koo"
00109         catalog     = ""
00110         programName = ki18n ("Koo")
00111         version     = "1.0"
00112         description = ki18n ("KDE OpenObject Client")
00113         license     = KAboutData.License_GPL
00114         copyright   = ki18n ("(c) 2009 Albert Cervera i Areny")
00115         text        = ki18n ("none")
00116         homePage    = "www.nan-tic.com"
00117         bugEmail    = "albert@nan-tic.com"
00118          
00119         aboutData   = KAboutData (appName, catalog, programName, version, description,
00120                                 license, copyright, text, homePage, bugEmail)
00121 
00122         KCmdLineArgs.init (sys.argv, aboutData)
00123          
00124         app = KApplication ()
00125 else:
00126         app = QApplication( sys.argv )
00127 
00128 try:
00129         app.setStyleSheet( file(Options.options['stylesheet']).read() )
00130 except:
00131         pass

00133 class KeyboardWidget(QWidget):
00134         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00135                 QWidget.__init__(self, parent)
00136                 from PyQt4.uic import loadUi
00137                 loadUi( Common.uiPath('keyboard.ui'), self )
00138                 self.connect( self.pushEscape, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.escape )
00139                 self.setWindowFlags( Qt.Popup )
00140                 self.setWindowModality( Qt.ApplicationModal )
00141                 pos = parent.mapToGlobal( parent.pos() )
00142                 self.move( pos.x(), pos.y() + parent.height() )
00143                 self.show()
00144 
00145         def escape(self):
00146                 self.hide()

00154         dbus.mainloop.qt.DBusQtMainLoop(set_as_default=True)
00155         sessionBus = dbus.SessionBus()
00156         name = dbus.service.BusName("org.openerp.Interface", sessionBus )
00157         example = OpenErpInterface('/OpenERP')

00159 from Koo.Dialogs.KooMainWindow import *
00160 from Koo.Dialogs.WindowService import *
00161 import Koo.Actions
00162 
00163 win = KooMainWindow()
00164 
00165 from Koo.Common import Api
00166 
00167 class KooApi(Api.KooApi):
00168         def execute(self, actionId, data={}, type=None, context={}):
00169                 Koo.Actions.execute( actionId, data, type, context )
00170 
00171         def executeReport(self, name, data={}, context={}):
00172                 return Koo.Actions.executeReport( name, data, context )
00173 
00174         def executeAction(self, action, data={}, context={}):
00175                 Koo.Actions.executeAction( action, data, context )
00176                 
00177         def executeKeyword(self, keyword, data={}, context={}):
00178                 return Koo.Actions.executeKeyword( keyword, data, context )
00179 
00180         def createWindow(self, view_ids, model, res_id=False, domain=None, 
00181                         view_type='form', window=None, context=None, mode=None, name=False, autoReload=False, 
00182                         target='current'):
00183                 WindowService.createWindow( view_ids, model, res_id, domain, 
00184                         view_type, window, context, mode, name, autoReload, target )
00185 
00186         def windowCreated(self, window, target):
00187                 win.addWindow( window, target )
00188 
00189 Api.instance = KooApi()
00190 
00191 win.show()

00193 if Options.options['pos_mode']:
00194         import Pos
00195         app.installEventFilter( Pos.PosEventFilter(win) )
00196 
00197 # The DebugEventFilter class has been used to find a problem with an invisible
00198 # widget that was created, not inserted in any layout and that didn't allow to 
00199 # click widgets below it. I'm leaving the code by now as it might be useful in the
00200 # future. Simply uncommenting the installEventFilter line will do.
00201 class DebugEventFilter(QObject):
00202         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00203                 QObject.__init__(self, parent)
00204                 
00205         def eventFilter(self, obj, event):
00206                 print "EVENT %d THROWN ON OBJECT '%s' OF TYPE '%s'" % ( event.type(), unicode(obj.objectName() ), unicode(obj.staticMetaObject.className()) )
00207                 return QObject.eventFilter( self, obj, event )
00208                 
00209 
00210 #app.installEventFilter( DebugEventFilter(win) )
00211 
00212 if Options.options.rcexist:
00213         if Options.options['tip.autostart']:
00214                 dialog = Common.TipOfTheDayDialog()
00215                 dialog.exec_()
00216         else:
00217                 win.showLoginDialog()
00218 app.exec_()
